rose.info: Used for skin care and in cosmetics. The petals have anti-inflammatory properties and are often used in face masks and lotions.
rose.habitat: Cultivated worldwide, especially in temperate regions. Thrives in well-drained soil and sunny locations.

tulsi.info: Used in Ayurveda for its medicinal properties. It is believed to enhance immunity and relieve stress.
tulsi.habitat: Native to the Indian subcontinent, grows in tropical and subtropical climates. Prefers sunny locations and well-drained soil.

aloevera.info: Known for its soothing and healing properties. Often used to treat burns, cuts, and other skin issues.
aloevera.habitat: Native to the Arabian Peninsula, but cultivated worldwide. Thrives in arid and semi-arid regions with well-drained soil.

lavender.info: Used in aromatherapy for relaxation and sleep improvement. The scent is known for its calming effects.
lavender.habitat: Native to the Mediterranean region. Grows well in dry, sandy, or gravelly soils and prefers full sun.

mint.info: Commonly used to aid digestion and relieve headaches. Mint leaves can be used in teas and culinary dishes.
mint.habitat: Widely distributed in temperate regions. Prefers moist, fertile soil and partial shade but can tolerate full sun.

chamomile.info: Used to promote relaxation and help with sleep. Chamomile tea is a popular remedy for insomnia and anxiety.
chamomile.habitat: Native to Europe and Western Asia. Grows in well-drained soil with full sun exposure.

dandelion.info: Used as a diuretic and to aid digestion. The leaves, roots, and flowers are used in various herbal remedies.
dandelion.habitat: Native to Eurasia and North America. Thrives in a variety of soil types and can grow in both sunny and shaded areas.

ginger.info: Known for its anti-nausea and anti-inflammatory properties. It is commonly used in cooking and as a remedy for nausea.
ginger.habitat: Native to Southeast Asia. Grows well in tropical and subtropical climates with rich, well-drained soil and partial shade.

turmeric.info: Contains curcumin, which has anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects. Often used in cooking and for its health benefits.
turmeric.habitat: Native to tropical South Asia. Prefers warm, humid climates with well-drained, fertile soil.

basil.info: Used in cooking and has antibacterial properties. Basil is also known for its potential anti-inflammatory effects.
basil.habitat: Native to tropical regions of central Africa and Southeast Asia. Thrives in warm, sunny locations with well-drained soil.

parsley.info: Rich in vitamins and used for its diuretic properties. Parsley is also a common garnish and has various health benefits.
parsley.habitat: Native to the Mediterranean region. Grows well in fertile, well-drained soil with partial shade.

thyme.info: Has antimicrobial properties and is used in cooking and medicine. Thyme is also used in traditional remedies for respiratory conditions.
thyme.habitat: Native to the Mediterranean region. Prefers dry, well-drained soil and full sun exposure.

rosemary.info: Used to improve memory and concentration, and for its antioxidant properties. Rosemary is commonly used in culinary dishes.
rosemary.habitat: Native to the Mediterranean region. Thrives in well-drained soil and full sun.

sage.info: Known for its digestive benefits and antimicrobial properties. Sage is often used in cooking and herbal medicine.
sage.habitat: Native to the Mediterranean region. Grows well in dry, sandy soil and full sun.

oregano.info: Contains antioxidants and is used for its anti-inflammatory effects. Oregano is commonly used in Italian cuisine and traditional medicine.
oregano.habitat: Native to Europe, the Mediterranean region, and Western Asia. Prefers dry, well-drained soil and full sun.

coriander.info: Used for its antioxidant and digestive benefits. Coriander seeds are used as a spice, and the leaves are used in salads and dishes.
coriander.habitat: Native to regions spanning from Southern Europe and Northern Africa to Western Asia. Thrives in well-drained soil with full sun.

fennel.info: Known for its digestive benefits and ability to reduce bloating. Fennel seeds are used in cooking and traditional remedies.
fennel.habitat: Native to the Mediterranean region. Grows well in well-drained soil and full sun.

jasmine.info: Used in aromatherapy for its calming effects and to reduce stress. Jasmine flowers are also used in perfumes and teas.
jasmine.habitat: Native to tropical and subtropical regions. Prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.

hibiscus.info: Rich in antioxidants and used to lower blood pressure. Hibiscus tea is a popular beverage known for its tart flavor.
hibiscus.habitat: Native to tropical and subtropical regions. Thrives in warm climates with well-drained soil.

echinacea.info: Boosts the immune system and is used to prevent colds. Echinacea is often used in herbal supplements and teas.
echinacea.habitat: Native to North America. Prefers well-drained soil and full sun.
